perturbation.changed_text:
(6) The payment of the Advertising Cost Compensation shall occur monthly
insofar as the sum due exceeds a value of 100 EUR / 100 USD. If this is not
the case, the sum due can be retained until a total value of at least 100
EUR / 100 USD is reached, at the latest, 90 days after the end of each quarter, irrespective of the Affiliate's participation in the Program.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding when the Advertising Cost Compensation is paid out if the 100 EUR/USD threshold is not met. Originally, it's paid upon termination. The modification states it will be paid 90 days after the end of each quarter, even if the Affiliate is still participating, creating confusion about the payment schedule and if the affiliate is not participating.

perturbation.original_text:
Either party may cancel this Agreement at any time, with or without
supplying a reason, through written notification or by making suitable
settings in the respective Control Panel.
perturbation.changed_text:
Either party may cancel this Agreement at any time, with or without
supplying a reason, through written notification. The Affiliate may cancel this agreement at any time with a 30-day written notice, with or without supplying a reason, by making suitable
settings in the respective Control Panel.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows either party to cancel at any time. The changed text imposes a 30-day written notice on the Affiliate for cancellation, creating a contradiction and ambiguity about the cancellation requirements for the Affiliate.

perturbation.changed_text:
(3) element 5 is authorized to retain final payment for a reasonable time,
minimum for 30 days after the end of the respective quarter, to ensure that
the correct amount is paid. However, element 5 is authorized to retain final payment indefinitely at their discretion.
Affiliate is only eligible to earn the Advertising Cost Compensation on
sales of Software Publishers Products occurring during the term of this
Agreement and fees earned up to the date termination will remain payable
only if the related orders are not cancelled or returned. If the
Advertising Cost Compensation was previously paid by element 5, it can be
offset or invoiced to Affiliate at element 5's own discretion.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a conflict regarding how long final payment can be retained. The original text provides a minimum of 30 days after the end of the quarter. The modified text states element 5 can retain final payment indefinitely, creating ambiguity and contradiction around the final payment terms. This creates uncertainty regarding when the final payment will be released and how long element 5 is allowed to hold the funds.
